Class AbstractValidatingView

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.actionfx.core.view.AbstractView
      • com.github.actionfx.core.view.AbstractValidatingView
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    View
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AbstractBindingView
    public abstract class AbstractValidatingView
extends AbstractView
    Abstract base class for an ActionFX view implementations.
    Author:
    koster

      • validate

        public ValidationResult validate​(boolean applyValidationDecoration)
        Description copied from interface: View
        Performs validations by applying validators added by calling #registerValidator(Control, Validator).

        Validation is guaranteed to be executed within the JavaFX application thread.

        Parameters:
        applyValidationDecoration - true, if validation decorations shall be applied to controls, false otherwise. In case no validation decorations shall be applied, it is up to the developer how to signal validation failures to the user of the UI.
        Returns:
        the result of the validation, including potential validation messages. If the validation was successful the result of ValidationResult.getStatus() will be ValidationStatus.OK.

      • registerValidator

        public void registerValidator​(javafx.scene.control.Control control,
                              ControlProperties controlProperty,
                              Validator validator,
                              ValidationOptions options)
        Description copied from interface: View
        Adds a validator to the specified control.
        Parameters:
        control - the control to validate
        controlProperty - the property of the given control whose value shall be validated
        validator - the validator to apply to the control
        options - defines several options, how the validator shall be applied to the given control (e.g. the validation mode of the given control e.g. ValidationMode.ONCHANGE, when the value of the control is changed, or ValidationMode.MANUAL, if the validation has to be manually triggered via View.validate())

      • registerValidator

        public void registerValidator​(java.lang.String nodeId,
                              ControlProperties controlProperty,
                              Validator validator,
                              ValidationOptions options)
        Description copied from interface: View
        Adds a validator to the control that will be looked up for the given nodeId.
        Parameters:
        nodeId - the nodeId that shall be resolved to a Control.
        controlProperty - the property of the given control whose value shall be validated
        validator - the validator to apply to the control
        options - defines several options, how the validator shall be applied to the given control (e.g. the validation mode of the given control e.g. ValidationMode.ONCHANGE, when the value of the control is changed, or ValidationMode.MANUAL, if the validation has to be manually triggered via View.validate())

        Redecorates all known components Only decorations related to validation are affected
